etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Fairbanks (Alaska) Daily News. From ring + wise

definitions: Knowledgeable about performance in a ring, especially a boxing ring. Also as noun with the and plural agreement: people knowledgeable about such matters as a class.
Skilled in the art and tactics of boxing or wrestling.

etymologies: late 16th century; earliest use found in Raphael Holinshed (c1525–?1580), historian. From ring + -wise

definitions: In a ring, so as to form a ring or rings.
